item.title: #en @ 1436047122357374988
item.description:
For 20+ years, Lincoln PD has been surveying citizens after they interacted with officers (e.g., cited, arrested, involved in an accident, or victim of select crimes).
Are there any other agencies with so many years of data on community perceptions?
https://t.co/HzDZTmr4lT https://t.co/eVxMaI9wTg

item.title: #en @ 1436044658396835842
item.description: In an enthusiastic and accessible way, I'll be sharing my decade long experience on the role of data in historical and social sciences. From basic data workflows, to global collaboration, from dirty excel files on a USB-drive to FAIR Linked Open Data on the Web. Hope to see you! https://t.co/JGnOsgUUGN

item.title: #en @ 1436043239681773579
item.description:
Realizing these days that my biggest strength is also my biggest weakness, I'm loyal AF to anyone who has gone to bat for me. This creates challenges when I get pulled in too many directions but also keeps many doors open.
I know others probably have similar dilemmas.

item.description: One of the pillars of #CCoMP is its commitment to open data and open science. And I'm so looking forward to working with YOU, our diverse science community, on new data streams, integration opportunities, and collaborative projects this center will yield!

item.title: #en @ 1435913345245143040
item.description: The idea behind #opendata is simple: an all-of-society approach to work towards a similar goal. That for Malaysia, is to win the battle against COVID-19. I'm thankful to MOH, @kharykj and his team for the opportunity and openness in collaborating with the open data community

item.title: #en @ 1435913343450030082
item.description: The devs behind are a team of 4 - all of us had built something with the MOH open data. We got together and worked with MOH over almost a month on building a transparent, easy to understand dashboard to better inform the public, orgs and policymakers on the state of the pandemic
